intro: Hieracium gothicum subsp. perangustum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and often have a serrated edge, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is generally a short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
